meanings.definition: Expurgators: those who remove objectionable material from a text.
meanings.sent1: The expurgators carefully removed the inappropriate words from the book.
meanings.sent2: The expurgators were tasked with cleaning up the novel before it was published.
meanings.sent3: The expurgators joked that they were like literary detectives hunting down naughty words.
meanings.sent4: The expurgators were like skilled surgeons, delicately excising the offensive passages.
meanings.sent5: The expurgators were the unsung heroes of the publishing world, ensuring only the best content reached the readers.

meanings.definition: Expurgators: the act of censoring or purifying a text by removing offensive or inappropriate content.
meanings.sent1: The expurgators' job was to make sure the book was suitable for all audiences.
meanings.sent2: The expurgators' work involved carefully reviewing and editing the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The expurgators playfully referred to themselves as the guardians of literary purity.
meanings.sent4: The expurgators' red pen was their weapon against unsuitable content.
meanings.sent5: The expurgators' mission was to cleanse the text of any offensive material, like digital janitors tidying up a webpage.
